intro: Cacalia stellaris, commonly known as starry cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Its most striking feature is its showy, star-like flowers, which are typically white or pale blue with yellow centers. Cacalia stellaris thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open areas such as meadows and rocky slopes.
